tweets.text: Check out a wonderful piece by @itvtynetees focusing on our @EnvAgency campaign to help safeguard the future of the rare native white-clawed #crayfish in the River Wansbeck by getting people to ‚Äòcheck ‚Äì clean ‚Äì dry‚Äô to prevent the spread of diseases. Story https://t.co/jGLaNSV0ml https://t.co/l5rSskbk0x

@bradfordmdc @EnvAgencyYNE @Bradford_TandA @WYFRS The application you refer to (from 2014 was 'granted' for a tyre fitting workshop) is different to the applic submitted in 2015 for a tyre disposal site (which was 'refused'). The question remains, does the site not have planning permission as a tyre disposal site? See attached. https://t.co/BYKNGgvCls
Check, clean, dry to safeguard the future of native White-clawed Crayfish in the River Wansbeck. More from @EnvAgencyYNE... https://t.co/N9IhjRAgAk

Certainly @EnvAgency (@EnvAgencyYNE), @bradfordmdc and @WYFRS should be answering questions about why no enforcement action was taken when the risk was identified in July. But who will pose them? Any courageous journalists at @Bradford_TandA or @yorkshirepost willing to step up? https://t.co/Fd4gHuvkqq

#BradfordFire üî• 

Why 6 months ago was this man not put in prison? 

Date of article: July 14th 2020 

https://t.co/LOo44icbgB https://t.co/3vrftJBJN1

@betterbradford This question just isn't being asked. Yes of course the firefighters have done an amazing job. But surely there were enforcement actions that could have been taken by @WYFRS, @bradfordmdc and/or @EnvAgency in July. Neither @Bradford_TandA nor @yorkshirepost reported this angle.
